# rvest

```{r message=FALSE}
library(rvest)
```

```{r}
url <- "https://pl.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lista_bank%C3%B3w_dzia%C5%82aj%C4%85cych_w_Polsce"
webpage <- read_html(url)
webpage
```

```{r}
records <- webpage %>% 
  html_nodes("table")
records
```

```{r}
records <- webpage %>% 
  html_nodes("table") %>%
  .[[1]] %>%
  html_nodes("td") %>% 
  head(10)

records
```

```{r}
records <- webpage %>% 
  html_nodes("table") %>%
  .[[1]] %>%
  html_nodes("td") %>%
  html_text() %>% 
  head(10)

records
```

```{r}
records <- webpage %>% 
  html_nodes("table") %>%
  .[[1]] %>%
  html_nodes("th, td") %>%
  html_text() %>%
  gsub('[\r\n\t]', '', .) %>% 
  head(10)

records
```

```{r results = 'asis'}
wynik_df <- records %>%
  tail(-13) %>% 
  matrix(ncol = 13, byrow = TRUE)%>% 
  data.frame()
  
colnames(wynik_df) <- head(records, 13)

head(wynik_df)
```

```{r echo = FALSE, results = 'asis', error = FALSE}
knitr::kable(wynik_df, format = "markdown")
```



## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo = FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
